meanings.definition: The state of being qualified for something.
meanings.sent1: Her eligibility for the scholarship was based on her high grades.
meanings.sent2: The eligibility criteria for the competition included age and experience.
meanings.sent3: His eligibility to join the club was questioned when he showed up in a costume.
meanings.sent4: The eligibility of the candidate shone brightly among the other applicants.
meanings.sent5: The eligibility of the team to compete was evident in their exceptional skills.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being eligible.
meanings.sent1: The company's eligibility for the award was undeniable.
meanings.sent2: She doubted the eligibility of the product due to its poor quality.
meanings.sent3: The eligibility of the cake for the contest was debated due to its unusual ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The eligibility of the painting stood out among the other submissions.
meanings.sent5: The eligibility of the student to participate was confirmed by the teacher.
